course_title: Topics in Afr American Studies: Voting Rights&VoterSuppression
class_notes:
TItle: Voting Rights and Voter Suppression


"This writing course will explore the various methods of voter suppression, how they affect African Americans' voting rights, as well as the strategies to overcome disfranchisement. The focus will be from the Mississippi Plan of 1890, through the Voting Rights Act of 1965, to the aftermath of the
Shelby County v. Holder (2013) US Supreme Court decision."
course_description: This course explores one of a wide range of topics pertaining to the African American experience in the fields of human and civil rights, social and literary texts, and the social sciences.
sections: Class Nbr: 3586, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 10-11:15a, Instructor: Anderson/Ross, Status: Open
